title: Hedwig's Theme played by traditional Chinese instruments
instruments: Erhu, Dizi, Guzheng, Pipa, Guqin, Dagu
artist: Guqin: Lijia Ye, Dizi: Ya Gao, Pipa: Jinning Gu, Erhu: Jing Zhu, Guzheng: Chenyao Yu, Dagu: Xi Chen
story: This music come from Harry Potter

comments.name: Micheal Lyons
comments.comment: Gosh, this is beautiful. Not just the music, but also how the video and musicians are laid out like a Chinese painting.

comments.name: Gary Wong
comments.comment: This is awesome in every way. Every single detail is perfect. Even the drooling drummer:) Love it!!!!!!

comments.name: Theodore Duncan
comments.comment: Awesome. And just when you thought you have had enough with Harry Potter theme which occurs in every HP universe movies, here it is reaching new heights. The players are amazing. Well done.

title: Yuan Qi Dao Xiang
artist: Guqin: Wuxia Bai, Xiao: Huabing Tu, Pipa: Jinning Gu, Guzheng: Chenyao Yu, Dagu: Xi Chen
story: This music come from the game of JX3

comments.name: Mattie Casarez
comments.comment: I have just now realized that everyone here is playing their instrument without musical notes in front of them. It is so impressive that they can remember the song from memory, but even more impressive that they can all create the music together as a team without sheet music. Such a talented and lovey team!

comments.name: Taylor Jade
comments.comment: Chinese classical music sounds like you are flying through a bamboo forest, passing the rivers and numerous mountain hills, both the wind and water is so soft...

comments.name: Adnan Natt
comments.comment: The interplay of instruments and their characteristic sounds in this piece is very beautiful. The effect of the ensemble is very pleasing.

title: Da La Beng Ba
instruments: Erhu, Guzheng, Pipa, Guqin, Dagu, Zhongruan, Dizi
artist: Guqin: Shan Caoi, Dizi: Ya Gao, Pipa: Jinning Gu, Guzheng: Chenyao Yu, Zhongruan: Ze Yan, Erhu: Jing Zhu, Dagu: Xi Chen
story: The song is called ‚ÄúDa La Beng Ba‚Äù, a song inspired by games and animation culture.

comments.name: Giovana Alpine
comments.comment: This was so wonderfully entertaining!  Please give subtitles so we can know what they are singing.  I so enjoy your videos!  The female singer had a wonderful voice. Loved all the special effects, too!

comments.name: Victoire Lesage
comments.comment: What fantastic way to introduce Chinese Traditional music. This is amazing.

comments.name: Sharon Tillson
comments.comment: This is so beautiful. Love the music and the clothing and the makeup

title: Air on the G string
artist: Zhudi: Huabing Lu, Lute: Hua Fan

comments.name: Aurora Anita
comments.comment: How magnificent!  The wooden flute & lute renders Bach's aria with stunning elegance.  The flutist provides a calm, measured base for the bright, elegant notes of the lutenist.  Both wooden instruments are masterpieces of their makers art & the musicians are perfect matches for their instruments.   An all round sublime experience.  Thank you.

comments.name: Fatima Hassan
comments.comment: 100 years ago when I was a young man I could never have imagined hearing this played with traditional Chinese instruments. It's possibly the best version I've heard, quite beautiful!

comments.name: Joan Hidaka
comments.comment: For some context of this piece of music: originally the aria movement from Bach's orchestral suite no. 3 in D major, thus it's in the key of D major. It wasn't until the 19th century virtuoso violinists decided to transcribe the whole movement into key of G so it can be played entirely on the lowest string of the violin to showcase both the violin's improvement and the high position needed to play the whole thing on 1 string. The name thus stuck and we now commonly refer to this movement as air on the g string

title: Tie Ma Yin
artist: GuZheng: Chenyao YuÔºå Compose: DengShan Zhao
story: Tie Ma is a kind of bell in the temple.

comments.name: Felicia Hill
comments.comment: the sound of Guzheng is soft and beautiful, it's a hug for the ears.

comments.name: Louis Applebee
comments.comment: This is definitely moving art!  Visually stunning and so pleasant to the ear. Well done!!

comments.name: Anne Weston
comments.comment: So enjoyed listening to this song üéµ as I had dinner.   I imagined a poet thinking that he was listening to a heavenly muse playing for him as he wrote his poetry in the Imperial court.  Perhaps, he'll write a poem of a journey to a beautiful city...

title: Xulai
artist: Pipa: Jinning Gu, Compose: Tianhua Liu

comments.name: Marcus Forest
comments.comment: Always a plesure to hear your traditional music!

comments.name: Ashley Jones
comments.comment: When you listen the best sounds in this world. Your heart tells that to you not your mind. This music made me feel that

comments.name: Dylan Walter
comments.comment: WOW!!!!!! Amazing dance and song. Beautiful, wonderful. It just catches your attention and it keeps you like in a trance till the end.

title: Birdsong in hollow valley
artist: Changd: Bin Tang, Guzheng: Shan Cai, Guqin: Wuxia Bai
story: This is the costume of the Chinese Song Dynasty. Beautiful Chinese court music style.

comments.name: Fionna Miller
comments.comment: This is the costume of the Chinese Song Dynasty. They are very accurate and the picture is very clean. It looks like ancient Chinese painting.

comments.name: Suzie Maxwell
comments.comment: As a filmmaker, this is just so beautiful to watch. Perfect composition in just the color choice/setting of microphones/placement of musicians. Whoever conceptualized this deserves an award.

comments.name: Alasie Rivers
comments.comment: I'm from Brazil and I love this genre of music. Congratulations for such a beautiful work! :)
